summary:
The Schengen Area is a special zone in Europe where 29 countries have removed border checks between each other. It's named after the Schengen Agreement signed in Luxembourg. Most European Union (EU) countries are part of it, except Cyprus and Ireland. Other European countries like Switzerland and Norway are also included.

In this area, people can travel freely, and goods can be transported more easily. Over 450 million people live here, and it covers a huge area. The Schengen Area makes it simpler for workers to commute across borders and helps trade by reducing costs.
title: Schengen Area
